title: Covid-19’s Omicron Surge Causes Déjà Vu Among Sports Broadcasters
sub_head: Television networks brace for revamped schedules as NHL, NBA and NFL postpone games because of coronavirus constraints
body:
The latest surge in coronavirus cases among professional athletes is once again forcing television networks to rearrange their schedules on the fly.
TNT, a unit of AT&T Inc.’s WarnerMedia, was slated to air a National Basketball Association game between the Washington Wizards and Brooklyn Nets on Tuesday. But because the Nets have too many players sidelined due to the virus, the game was postponed, and TNT has decided to show the Indiana Pacers’ game with the Miami Heat instead.
